<a id="class_CameraAttributes"></a>

# CameraAttributes

**Inherits:** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

**Inherited By:** [CameraAttributesPhysical](class_cameraattributesphysical.md), [CameraAttributesPractical](class_cameraattributespractical.md)

Parent class for camera settings.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Controls camera-specific attributes such as depth of field and exposure override.

When used in a [WorldEnvironment](class_worldenvironment.md) it provides default settings for exposure, auto-exposure, and depth of field that will be used by all cameras without their own **CameraAttributes**, including the editor camera. When used in a [Camera3D](class_camera3d.md) it will override any **CameraAttributes** set in the [WorldEnvironment](class_worldenvironment.md). When used in [VoxelGI](class_voxelgi.md) or [LightmapGI](class_lightmapgi.md), only the exposure settings will be used.

See also [Environment](class_environment.md) for general 3D environment settings.

This is a pure virtual class that is inherited by [CameraAttributesPhysical](class_cameraattributesphysical.md) and [CameraAttributesPractical](class_cameraattributespractical.md).

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_CameraAttributes_property_auto_exposure_enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **auto_exposure_enabled** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#class_CameraAttributes_property_auto_exposure_enabled)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_auto_exposure_enabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **is_auto_exposure_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, enables the tonemapping auto exposure mode of the scene renderer. If ``true``, the renderer will automatically determine the exposure setting to adapt to the scene's illumination and the observed light.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CameraAttributes_property_auto_exposure_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **auto_exposure_scale** = `0.4` [ðŸ”—](#class_CameraAttributes_property_auto_exposure_scale)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_auto_exposure_scale**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_auto_exposure_scale**\ (\ )

The scale of the auto exposure effect. Affects the intensity of auto exposure.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CameraAttributes_property_auto_exposure_speed"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **auto_exposure_speed** = `0.5` [ðŸ”—](#class_CameraAttributes_property_auto_exposure_speed)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_auto_exposure_speed**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_auto_exposure_speed**\ (\ )

The speed of the auto exposure effect. Affects the time needed for the camera to perform auto exposure.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CameraAttributes_property_exposure_multiplier"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **exposure_multiplier** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#class_CameraAttributes_property_exposure_multiplier)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_exposure_multiplier**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_exposure_multiplier**\ (\ )

Multiplier for the exposure amount. A higher value results in a brighter image.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CameraAttributes_property_exposure_sensitivity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **exposure_sensitivity** = `100.0` [ðŸ”—](#class_CameraAttributes_property_exposure_sensitivity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_exposure_sensitivity**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_exposure_sensitivity**\ (\ )

Sensitivity of camera sensors, measured in ISO. A higher sensitivity results in a brighter image.

If [auto_exposure_enabled](class_cameraattributes.md#class_CameraAttributes_property_auto_exposure_enabled) is ``true``, this can be used as a method of exposure compensation, doubling the value will increase the exposure value (measured in EV100) by 1 stop.

\ **Note:** Only available when [ProjectSettings.rendering/lights_and_shadows/use_physical_light_units](class_projectsettings.md#class_ProjectSettings_property_rendering/lights_and_shadows/use_physical_light_units) is enabled.
